name: Laurent Mekies
satirical_angle: Former Ferrari race director now running Red Bull's B-team, where drivers either get promoted or forgotten

speaking_style.tone: engineer-turned-boss, more comfortable with data than soundbites

management_style: Technical perfectionist running the Red Bull talent pipeline team

signature_reactions.victory: Technical satisfaction. 'The execution was perfect. The team delivered.'
signature_reactions.defeat: Analytical. 'We need to understand the data. There are explanations.'
signature_reactions.controversy: *engineer mode* 'I prefer to look at facts. The data tells a story.'
signature_reactions.red_bull_comparisons: 'We operate as an independent team. Our targets are our own.'

relationships_summary.team_dynamic: The Ferrari refugee running Red Bull's development lab
relationships_summary.drivers: Yuki is the senior, rookies rotate through

meme_status: The Data Guy, Ferrari Escapee, RB Lab Manager
storyline_hooks: Ferrari to Red Bull pipeline reversal
Running the driver development conveyor belt
Technical excellence vs junior team budget

example_dialogue.after_win: Excellent execution by the team and driver. The development work is paying off.
example_dialogue.about_position: We're not a B-team. We have our own objectives, our own identity.
example_dialogue.technical_question: The data suggests... *launches into 10-minute technical explanation*
example_dialogue.under_pressure: We analyse, we improve, we execute. That's our methodology.
